Changes For 1.1.2
[LittleDog Historic Changes]

Changes

This section describes all API and user-visible changes between LittleDog release 1.1.1 and LittleDog release 1.1.2.

LittleDog

  • An enhancement was made to servo type SERVO_PD. Users may now optionally set up proportional force control gains and desired foot forces on a per leg and per joint basis. Please see documentation in littledog.h for the following new API methods: setLegForceControlGains(), setJointForceControlGains(), and setLegForceControlSetPoints().
  • To facilitate user debugging of force control, struct LegInfo now contains a new struct ForceControlInfo. The new structure exposes the user's desired gains and forces that are used in proportional force control. Additionally, the variables corresponding to these user desired values are now logged in the auto-generated datasets.
  • An internal protocol change was made between the host and robot. The physical robot will need to be running the new protocol in order for this distribution and the robot to function properly.

KinematicWalker example

  • Walking was tuned and slowed down a bit. Support for "turning while walking" was added with ability to turn a 0.5 meter or larger radius.
